duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide hands-on care to patients in an evidence-based manner, within the Scope of Practice of the California Nursing Practice Act, regulatory requirements, and hospital policies.

Perform all steps of the nursing process, including assessing patients, interpreting data, planning, implementing, and evaluating care; coordinating care with other providers; and teaching the patient and family the knowledge and skills needed to manage their care and prevent complications.
Establish and maintain therapeutic relationships, mobilize the patient's strengths, and abilities towards participation in recovery and control over the plan of care.
Obtain accurate and relevant assessment data, interpret the data, determine nursing diagnosis, and monitor and evaluate data as frequently as needed based on stability.

Collaborate with the patient, family, and members of the health care team to develop an individualized plan of care; implement nursing and medical interventions safely; and evaluate the effectiveness of interventions.

Assess a patient's and family's learning needs and readiness to learn; teach needed information for self-care and illness prevention; and adjust information and expectations based on responses from the patient, developmental levels, physiological and psychological condition, and cultural variations.
Ability to rapidly grasp problem situations, respond quickly and appropriately, identify the need for and activate emergency protocols, and monitor and ensure quality healthcare practices.

Integrate multiple requests and work expectations by setting priorities, delegating tasks appropriately, seeking assistance as needed, and contributing to team building through participation in unit programs and meetings.

Learn and utilize the available technology for communication, documentation, and locating information regarding unusual clinical situations, diagnosis, and treatments; contribute to the knowledge and skill of other members of the nursing staff through formal or informal teaching, participation in professional groups, publications, and presentations.

Attain knowledge and competence that reflects current nursing practice, demonstrate commitment to lifelong learning, communicate effectively in a variety of formats in all areas of practice, and demonstrate leadership in the professional practice setting and the profession; evaluate own nursing practice in relation to professional practice standards and guidelines, relevant statutes, rules, and regulations.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) from an accredited college or university preferred.
Current American Heart Association Certification for Basic Life Support for Healthcare Providers CA-RN (Registered Nurse)
